title: `popstate` triggers `beforeNavigate`/`afterNavigate` for hash changes
body:
### Describe the bug

If you click a `<a href="#foo">` link, `beforeNavigate` and `afterNavigate` callbacks are not called, which I think is correct, since clicking on a hash link doesn't constitute a navigation as far as SvelteKit is concerned.

But if you then click the back button, the callbacks _are_ called. In fact we execute a full navigation â€” it's just that most of the steps are a no-op, since the code is already loaded and the data is guaranteed to remain valid.

Bailing out of the navigation in `popstate` if the URL is the same, apart from the the hash, would save SvelteKit from doing a bunch of unnecessary work, but more importantly it would fix the inconsistency. The alternative way to solve the inconsistency would be to _also_ trigger callbacks when the link is clicked, but I think consistently _not_ calling them is preferable.

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-4stmd9?file=src%2Froutes%2F%2Blayout.svelte,src%2Froutes%2F%2Bpage.svelte&terminal=dev

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
    @sveltejs/adapter-node: ^1.0.0 => 1.1.4

    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.0.0 => 1.2.9

    vite: ^4.0.4 => 4.0.4
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

I'm inclined to fix this before continuing with #8710, since otherwise that PR will be more complex than it needs to be.
